archetype_name: Family Skillet Curries & Stir-Fries (Medium Heat, 15–30, Intermediate)
name: Thai Red Curry Fish with Baby Corn and Bok Choy
description: Tender fish gently poached in a fragrant Thai red curry with baby corn and bok choy, served over fluffy jasmine rice. Medium heat and weeknight-fast on the stovetop.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear; set aside.
Chop 300 g bok choy into bite-size pieces, separating stems and leaves.
Drain 200 g baby corn; cut into bite-size pieces if large.
Cut 600 g fish fillets into 2–3 cm pieces; pat dry.
cook_steps: Cook rice: Add rinsed jasmine rice to a pot with water (per pack ratio). Bring to a boil, cover, reduce heat to low, and cook until tender. Keep covered off-heat.
Microwave baby corn for 1 minute to pre-warm; set aside.
Heat 1 tbsp canola oil in a wide skillet over medium heat. Add sliced shallots and cook 2 minutes until softened. Add minced garlic; cook 30 seconds.
Stir in 3 tbsp Thai red curry paste and cook 1 minute to bloom.
Pour in 1 can (400 ml) coconut milk and 1 tbsp fish sauce. Bring to a gentle simmer.
Add bok choy stems and the warmed baby corn; simmer 2–3 minutes until slightly tender.
Nestle fish pieces into the simmering curry in a single layer. Simmer gently (do not boil) for 4–6 minutes until fish flakes easily.
Stir in bok choy leaves and a pinch of chili flakes (optional). Simmer 1 minute until wilted. Taste; add more fish sauce or a small pinch of salt if needed.
Fluff rice. Serve curry over rice with lime wedges for squeezing.
